resources.name: Get all tickets
resources.description:
## `GET` /Ticket
 Returns all tickets

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl -X GET \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/'
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: Get ticket with ID 1
resources.description:
## `GET` /Ticket/:TicketID
 Returns the ticket with the specified Id.

#### Route Params
`id` *The ticket ID*

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl -X GET \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10'
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: Get ticket Followup
resources.description:
## `GET` /Ticket/:TicketID/TicketFollowup
 Returns the followup of the Ticket specified

#### Route Params
`id` *The ticket ID*

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl -X GET \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/TicketFollowup'
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: Create ticket
resources.description:
## `POST` /Ticket
 Create a ticket. You must pass a `input` param with the json with the params, follow some param examples.

#### Params
`name`: *Ticket title*

`content` *Ticket description*

`urgency` *Ticket urgency* 

`impact` *Ticket impact*

`type` *Ticket type (requisition or incident)*

`itilcategories_id` *Ticket categories* 
		

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl --request POST \
  --url http://glpi.beltis.com.br/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/ \
  --data '{
	"input": {
		"name": "TESTE de ticket",
		"content": "Teste de criação de ticket via API",
		"urgency": 5,
		"impact": 3,
		"type": 2,
		"itilcategories_id": 22,
		"requesttype": 7
	}
}'
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/TicketFollowup' 
```

#### Response
```json
{
  "id": 5421,
  "message": "Item adicionado com sucesso: TESTE de ticket"
}
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: Add FollowUp to Ticket
resources.description:
## `POST` /Ticket/:ticketID/TicketFollowup
 Add a followup to the ticket. You must pass a `input` param with the json with the params.

#### Route Params
`id` *The ticket ID*

#### Params
`tickets_id` *Id of the ticket to add the followup*

`content` *Content of the followup*

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl --request POST \
  --url http://glpi.beltis.com.br/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/TicketFollowup \
  --data '{
	"input": {
		"ticket": 10,
		"content": "Ticket followup test"
	}
}'
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/TicketFollowup' 
```

#### Response
```json
{
  "id": 5421,
  "message": ""
}
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: Update Ticket
resources.description:
## `POST` /Ticket/:ticketID/Change_Ticket
 Update ticket. You must pass a `input` param with the json with the params.

#### Route Params
`id` *The ticket ID*

#### Params
`tickets_id` *Id of the ticket to add the followup*

`param` *The param to update. You must use same params used to create the ticket*

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`Session-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

###### Note
 It's possible to use the search params on any items, such as tickets.

```sh
curl --request POST \
  --url http://glpi.beltis.com.br/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/Chante_Ticket \
  --data '{
	"input": {
		"ticket": 10,
		"content": "Ticket followup test"
	}
}'
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/Ticket/10/Chante_Ticket' 
```

#### Response
```json
{
  "id": 5421,
  "message": ""
}
```
---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: initSession
resources.description:
## `GET` /initSession
 Creates a session, providing a session token to use the other endpoints

#### HEADERS
`App-Token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

You must authenticate to get a session token. You can pass a user and password parameter, or a authorization with two methods:

`login` *The username to creates the session*

`password` *The user password to creates the session*

##### OR

`Authorization: Basic base64({login}:{password})`

##### OR

`Authorization: user_token USER_TOKEN` 
``` sh
#the user token is recoverable at User > Preferences > api token
```

```sh
curl -X GET \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H "Authorization: user_token q56hqkniwot8wntb3z1qarka5atf365taaa2uyjrn" \
  -H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
  'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/initSession'
```

### __Response__
 The response is a JSON containing the session token.
 ```json
{
  "session_token":"TOKEN"
}
```

---
API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php

resources.name: killSession
resources.description:
## `GET` /killSession
 Destroy the session with the session_token provided
## __Headers__
`app_token` *The app token provided by GLPI*

`session_token` *The session token*

```sh
curl -X GET \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H "Session-Token: 83af7e620c83a50a18d3eac2f6ed05a3ca0bea62" \
-H "App-Token: f7g3csp8mgatg5ebc5elnazakw20i9fyev1qopya7" \
'http://path/to/glpi/apirest.php/killSession'
```
---

API documentation: http://PATH/TO/GLPI/apirest.php
